p: Polemonium is a model system for studies of pollinator‐mediated selection (Galen, 1996; Galen, Kaczorowski, Todd, Geib, & Raguso, 2011). If woody encroachment alters pollinator foraging behavior, it may select for functional traits that limit pollen interference before (e.g., corolla tube length; Galen & Cuba, 2001) or after pollination (e.g., style length; Ashman & Arceo‐Gómez, 2013). By elucidating timing of interference, experiments reported in this paper are a first step in addressing how pollinator sharing under willow encroachment may alter selection on these traits.
